column2: I feel myself that it is time the obscurity attending those two names—Ellis and Acton—was done away. The little mystery
column3: which formerly yielded some harmless pleasure
column4: has lost its interest; circumstances are changed. It becomes
column6: my duty to explain briefly the origin and authorship of the books written by Currer
column8: and Acton Bell.About five years ago
column10: after a somewhat prolonged period of separation
column12: and at home. Resident in a remote district
column13: where education had made little progress
column16: there was no inducement to seek social intercourse beyond our own domestic circle
column17: we were wholly dependent on ourselves and each other
column19: for the enjoyments and occupations of life. The highest stimulus
column20: as well as the liveliest pleasure we had known from childhood upwards
column21: lay in attempts at literary composition; formerly we used to show each other what we wrote
column22: but of late years this habit of communication and consultation had been discontinued; hence it ensued
column23: that we were mutually ignorant of the progress we might respectively have made.
